body:
This appears to be caused by differences in unicode normalisation

```
"hello? sausage/êé/Hello, 世界/ \" ' @ < > & ?/z.txt"
"hello? sausage/êé/Hello, 世界/ \" ' @ < > & ?/z.txt"
```

Which seem identical in my browser, but when I look at them in emacs, the first one appears as `e^e'` rather than `êé`

```
>>> a = u"êé"
>>> b = u"êé"
>>> a.encode("utf-8")
'e\xcc\x82e\xcc\x81'
>>> b.encode("utf-8")
'\xc3\xaa\xc3\xa9'
```

I'm sure I read about OS X doing this somewhere... Eg https://developer.apple.com/legacy/library/technotes/tn/tn1150.html

issue.title: Normalize file paths/names.

issue.body:
CI tests now tests `go vet`, `go fmt` (via goimports) and `golint`.

Adds Travis experimental OSX support.
Add "tip" tests. Can give an early indication about issues in upcoming Go versions.

This makes contributing easier, since users will get automatic "style errors".

body: I've removed the OS X build from travis for the moment in a4f3548bbfc20d7f82eebe15441c3d0c97b465ff

issue.title: OSX Error checking changes on files with accents

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
### VERSION:

rclone v1.29
### COMPUTER:

64bit
Mac OS 10.11.4 Beta (15E33e)
MacBook Pro (Retina, 15-inch, Early 2013)
2,7 GHz Intel Core i7
16 GB 1600 MHz DDR3
NVIDIA GeForce GT 650M 1024 MB
### REMOTE SERVICE:

Google Drive
### COMMAND:

./rclone copy -v "remote:/path/o/file" "path/to/local/file"
### LOG:

There is no strange in the log. See problem section below to know what happens.

---
### PROBLEM:

When I have files with accents in its name, rclone does not find then and downloads it every time and it says "path/to/file: Copied (new)".

If I change the name and remove the accent, everything goes ok. I.e. _revisión.doc_ -> _revision.doc_.

I think this should be a simple problem due to string comparison encoding.

Thanks for this great utility!

issue.title: SSH_FX_FAILURE for removing (some) directories

repository.name: sftp
repository.description: SFTP support for the go.crypto/ssh package

issue.body:
Like #35, I get for some directories I would like to remove, an `SSH_FX_FAILURE` error. I updated your package's Go code yesterday. Therefore, I should have the fix of #35. What can I do in order to analyse this issue?

At the moment, all directories with this error uses UTF8 characters, e.g. umlauts like ö, ü, ä, etc.

As I am writing this, I got an idea: I switched from Windows 10 to Mac OS X, thus, my Go program runs now under Mac. I recognised yesterday, that the same Go code handles such file names with umlauts differently (Windows vs Mac). Or, at least, both operating systems deliver different strings to Go and therefore to this library. Because: All remote directories, which I cannot delete right now (`SSH_FX_FAILURE`) are created from the Go program under Windows 10 and cannot deleted from within Mac OS.

Perhaps, this post helps some other users/developers. I will investigate this issue further and can close this issue later, if I had a solution. Thanks.
